Swaledale Cheese and Swaledale Ewes Chee: Swaledale cheese has been produced in the Dales for 500 years or more
and in texture and taste not unsurprisingly is similar to Wensleydale which is produced in the neighbouring dale.
Swaledale and Swaledale Ewes Cheese are both Protected Designations of Origin
%u2013 the difference being that Swaledale is made from local cows%u2019 milk and the Ewes%u2019 version from locally produced sheep milk
See the section "British Protected Name Cheeses".
